title: What Does the 💎 Diamond Emoji Mean?

steps.title: The 💎 (diamond) emoji most often represents diamonds or jewelry.
steps.content: The 💎 (diamond) emoji most often represents diamonds or jewelry. Over text and on most social media platforms like WhatsApp, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, or Snapchat, the 💎 symbolizes a real diamond. It can also represent jewelry made from precious gemstones. [1] X Research source

steps.title: The 💎 (diamond) emoji can signify an engagement or marriage.
steps.content: The 💎 (diamond) emoji can signify an engagement or marriage. Ever heard the saying, “Diamonds are forever”? If you see the 💎 in a post or message about a couple, proposal, or wedding, it represents a lifelong commitment. It can also refer to a diamond engagement or wedding ring. [2] X Research source

steps.title: The 💎 (diamond) emoji can be a symbol of wealth, luxury, or beauty.
steps.content: The 💎 (diamond) emoji can be a symbol of wealth, luxury, or beauty. Sometimes, the 💎 is used to say something is stunning or costs a lot of money. Diamonds are both gorgeous and expensive, after all. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Use the 💎 (diamond) emoji when you’re talking about precious gems.
steps.content: Use the 💎 (diamond) emoji when you’re talking about precious gems. Whether you’re showing off a new piece of jewelry or on the hunt for a one-of-a-kind vintage ring, the 💎 will help you get your point across. “The hubs gave me a diamond tennis bracelet for my birthday! ❤️💎” "Visiting the Tower of London to see the crown jewels 👑💎" “Tiffany & Co. is having a sale! 💎💲💎”

steps.title: Use the 💎 (diamond) emoji to celebrate an engagement or marriage.
steps.content: Use the 💎 (diamond) emoji to celebrate an engagement or marriage. Add a 💎 to your message or post to show love and support to the happy couple. “Did you see Shayla’s ring? 💍💎 It’s gorgeous!” “Congratulations Darryl and Adriana! 🤍⛪💎” "Me and you forever, babe 💎💎"

steps.title: Use the 💎 (diamond) emoji to say something is expensive, luxurious, or beautiful.
steps.content: Use the 💎 (diamond) emoji to say something is expensive, luxurious, or beautiful. Drop a 💎 to signify just how stunning or flawless something or someone is. [4] X Research source "That sailing yacht?! 💎⛵" “You look gorgeous!! 👗💎” “Your presentation was flawless! 💎”

steps.title: On Tinder, the 💎 (diamond) emoji represents one of your top picks.
steps.content: On Tinder, the 💎 (diamond) emoji represents one of your top picks. If you see a 💎 on someone’s profile, it means they are in your Top Picks. Tinder uses an algorithm to match people based on the info in your bios, so a 💎 is Tinder’s way of telling you that you two are a top 10 match. [5] X Research source

steps.title: The 💎 (diamond) emoji could mean the person uses crystal meth.
steps.content: The 💎 (diamond) emoji could mean the person uses crystal meth. On the popular LGBTQ+ app Grindr, the 💎 has come to symbolize drug use. It’s usually put in a person’s profile to signify that they like to “party and play” or “PNP” which means to have sex under the influence of the illegal drug crystal meth, known on the streets as Tina (hence the capital T). [6] X Research source

steps.title: The 💎 emoji is related to other luxury and relationship emojis.
steps.content: The 💎 emoji is related to other luxury and relationship emojis. Check out these other emojis and what they mean to talk about your love for beautiful things or celebrate your commitment to your partner: The 👑 (crown) emoji symbolizes luxury, power, or royalty. It can also refer to seeing your partner as your king or queen. The 💍 (ring) emoji symbolizes opulence. It also refers to love, engagement, marriage, and commitment. The ✨ (sparkles) emoji represents beauty, magic, and glittery jewels. The 💕 (two hearts) emoji symbolizes love between 2 people. It can also mean love is in the air. The 🥂 (clinking glasses) emoji represents celebration and congratulations.
